intro: Tarenna zygoon, commonly known as the zigzag tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
